kinetic.client

Class KineticException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • kinetic.client.KineticException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AsyncKineticException, BatchAbortedException, ClusterVersionFailureException, EntryNotFoundException, VersionMismatchException

    public class KineticException
extends java.lang.Exception
    Kinetic Client root Exception. All Kinetic client exceptions extend from this class.

    For each KineticClient synchronous operation, a KineticException or its subclass instance is raised should the system encountered an error. For example, version mismatch for a KineticClient.put(Entry, byte[]) operation. The root cause exception (if any) may be set in the KineticException instance.

    Applications may obtain the root cause exception through the Throwable.getCause() API.

    For each KineticClient asynchronous operation, a failed operation would cause an AsyncCallbackException be generated and delivered to the registered CallbackHandler.onError(AsyncKineticException) method.

    Author:
    Chiaming Yang
    See Also:
    AsyncKineticException, KineticClient, Serialized Form
